info.title: Math & Science Equation API
info.description: API endpoints to calculate various physics equations. Documentation is generated from JSDoc comments.

tags.name: API Information
tags.description: Endpoints for general API information and metadata.

post.description: Calculates the acceleration directed towards the center of a circular path using linear velocity and radius.

r.description: Radius of the circular path (e.g., m). Cannot be zero.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, radius is zero).

error.example: Input 'v' must be a finite number.

post.summary: Calculates centripetal acceleration (a_c = -ω^2 * r) using angular velocity
post.description: Calculates the centripetal acceleration vector component using angular velocity and radius. The negative sign indicates direction towards the center.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4)

result.description: Centripetal acceleration (a_c) (e.g., m/s^2). Negative indicates towards center.

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers).

error.example: Input 'omega' must be a finite number.

post.summary: Calculates electric force using Coulomb's Law (F = k * q1*q2 / r^2)
post.description: Calculates the electric force between two point charges. Returns signed force (positive for repulsion, negative for attraction).

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, distance is zero).

post.summary: Calculates electric field from force (E = F_E/q)
post.description: Calculates the electric field strength based on the force exerted on a test charge.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, charge is zero).

post.summary: Calculates electric potential from potential energy change (V = ΔU_E/q)
post.description: Calculates the electric potential (voltage) based on the change in electric potential energy per unit charge. Note- Function name `calculateElectricPotential` is correct, but parameter `deltaUE` implies change, while the equation is typically V=U_E/q or ΔV=ΔU_E/q. Documenting based on the equation ΔV = ΔU_E/q and returning ΔV.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

200.description: Successful calculation of electric potential change.

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, charge is zero).

post.summary: Calculates electric field from potential difference (E = ΔV/d)
post.description: Calculates the magnitude of a uniform electric field based on the potential difference across a distance. Note- Function name "Field and Potential" is misleading; it calculates the Electric Field E.

d.description: Distance over which the potential changes (d)

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, distance is zero).

post.description: Calculates capacitance based on the charge stored and the voltage across a capacitor.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, voltage is zero).

post.description: Calculates the capacitance of a parallel plate capacitor with a dielectric. Note- Function uses k * ε₀ as a single input (`kEpsilon`).

kEpsilon.description: Product of relative permittivity and vacuum permittivity (k * ε₀)

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, distance is zero).

post.description: Calculates the capacitance of a cylindrical capacitor with a dielectric. Note- Function uses k * ε₀ as a single input (`kEpsilon`).

kEpsilon.description: Product of relative permittivity and vacuum permittivity (k * ε₀)

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, inner radius is zero, r1 >= r2).

post.description: Calculates the capacitance of a spherical capacitor with a dielectric. Note- Function uses k * ε₀ as a single input (`kEpsilon`).

kEpsilon.description: Product of relative permittivity and vacuum permittivity (k * ε₀)

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, inner radius is zero, r1 >= r2).

post.description: Checks if the three common equations for potential energy stored in a capacitor are equivalent for the given Q, V, and C. Returns boolean. Note- Uses strict equality (===) which may be sensitive to floating-point precision; consider tolerance for real-world checks.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, capacitance is zero).

post.description: Calculates electric current based on the amount of charge passing through a point per unit time.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, time interval is zero).

post.description: Calculates the average charge density (charge per unit volume).

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, volume is zero).

post.description: Calculates electric current density (current per unit cross-sectional area).

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, area is zero).

post.summary: Calculates resistance using Ohm's Law (R = V/I)
post.description: Calculates resistance based on voltage and current. Note- The function calculates Resistance R from V and I.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, current is zero).

post.description: Calculates conductivity (σ) from resistivity (ρ).

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, resistivity is zero).

post.description: Calculates the resistance of a conductor based on its resistivity, length, and cross-sectional area. Note- Uses `rhoValue` for resistivity.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, area is zero).

post.summary: Validates electric power equations (P = VI = I^2R = V^2/R)
post.description: Checks if the three common equations for electric power are equivalent for the given V, I, and R. Returns boolean. Note- Uses strict equality (===) which may be sensitive to floating-point precision; consider tolerance for real-world checks.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

result.description: True if the power equations hold.

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, resistance is zero).

post.summary: Calculates total resistance for resistors in series (R_total = R1 + R2 + ...)
post.description: Calculates the total equivalent resistance for multiple resistors connected in series.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers in the array).

post.summary: Calculates total resistance for resistors in parallel (1/R_total = 1/R1 + 1/R2 + ...)
post.description: Calculates the total equivalent resistance for multiple resistors connected in parallel.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers in the array, any resistance is zero).

post.summary: Calculates total capacitance for capacitors in series (1/C_total = 1/C1 + 1/C2 + ...)
post.description: Calculates the total equivalent capacitance for multiple capacitors connected in series.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers in the array, any capacitance is zero).

post.summary: Calculates total capacitance for capacitors in parallel (C_total = C1 + C2 + ...)
post.description: Calculates the total equivalent capacitance for multiple capacitors connected in parallel.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers in the array).

post.summary: Calculates magnetic force on a charged particle (F = qvB sin(θ))
post.description: Calculates the magnitude of the magnetic force exerted on a moving charged particle. Angle should be in radians.

theta.description: Angle between velocity and magnetic field vectors in radians (θ)

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers).

post.summary: Calculates magnetic force on a current-carrying conductor (F = I l B sin(θ))
post.description: Calculates the magnitude of the magnetic force exerted on a straight conductor carrying current in a magnetic field. Angle should be in radians.

l.description: Length of the conductor in the field (l)

theta.description: Angle between current direction and magnetic field vector in radians (θ)

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers).

post.summary: Calculates magnetic field from a current element (dB = (μ₀I ds) / (4πr^2))
post.description: Calculates the magnitude of the magnetic field contribution from a differential current element perpendicular to the radius vector. Note- The function implements `(μ₀ * I * ds) / (4 * π * r^2)`, omitting the sin(θ) term often present in the differential form, effectively assuming θ=90 degrees or calculating only the component perpendicular to the radius vector in that specific plane. Documenting the equation implemented.

r.description: Distance from the current element to the point (r)

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

200.description: Successful calculation of magnetic field contribution.

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, distance is zero).

post.summary: Calculates magnetic field inside a long solenoid (B = μ₀nI)
post.description: Calculates the magnitude of the magnetic field inside a long ideal solenoid.

n.description: Number of turns per unit length (n)

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers).

post.summary: Calculates magnetic field from an infinite straight wire (B = (μ₀I)/(2πr))
post.description: Calculates the magnitude of the magnetic field at a distance from a long, straight conductor carrying current.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, distance is zero).

post.summary: Calculates force per unit length between parallel wires (F/L = (μ₀I₁I₂)/(2πd))
post.description: Calculates the magnitude of the force per unit length between two long, parallel conductors carrying currents.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

200.description: Successful calculation of force per unit length.

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, distance is zero).

post.summary: Calculates electric flux (Φ_E = E * A * cos(θ))
post.description: Calculates the electric flux through a flat surface in a uniform electric field. Angle should be between the electric field vector and the area vector, in radians.

theta.description: Angle between E and A vectors in radians (θ)

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers).

post.summary: Calculates magnetic flux (Φ_B = B * A * cos(θ))
post.description: Calculates the magnetic flux through a flat surface in a uniform magnetic field. Angle should be between the magnetic field vector and the area vector, in radians.

theta.description: Angle between B and A vectors in radians (θ)

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers).

post.description: Calculates the magnitude of the emf induced in a conductor moving perpendicular to a magnetic field. Note- The function calculates the magnitude Blv, omitting the negative sign sometimes used for direction (Lenz's Law).

l.description: Length of the conductor perpendicular to velocity and field (l)

v.description: Velocity perpendicular to the field and conductor (v)

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

200.description: Successful calculation of induced emf magnitude.

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers).

post.summary: Calculates induced emf from changing flux (emf = -ΔΦ_B / Δt)
post.description: Calculates the emf induced by a changing magnetic flux according to Faraday's Law of Induction.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, time interval is zero).

post.summary: Calculates induced emf from changing current in an inductor (emf = -L * ΔI / Δt)
post.description: Calculates the self-induced emf in an inductor due to a changing current. Note- The function is named `calculateInductance` but returns emf using this equation. Documenting what it returns.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, time interval is zero).

post.description: Calculates the opposition of a capacitor to alternating current.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, frequency or capacitance is zero).

post.description: Calculates the opposition of an inductor to alternating current.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers).

post.description: Calculates the total opposition to current flow in an AC circuit containing resistance, inductive reactance, and capacitive reactance.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers).

post.description: Calculates density based on mass and volume.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, Volume is zero).

post.description: Calculates pressure based on force applied over an area.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, Area is zero).

post.summary: Calculates pressure in a fluid (P = P0 + ρgh)
post.description: Calculates the absolute pressure at a certain depth in a fluid.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

200.description: Successful calculation of pressure in fluid.

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers).

post.description: Calculates the buoyant force exerted by a fluid on a submerged or partially submerged object (Archimedes' principle).

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers).

post.description: Calculates the rate at which mass passes a point per unit time.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

200.description: Successful calculation of mass flow rate.

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, deltaT is zero).

post.description: Calculates the rate at which volume passes a point per unit time.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

200.description: Successful calculation of volume flow rate.

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, deltaT is zero).

post.summary: Checks Bernoulli's equation (P1 + ρgy1 + 0.5ρv1^2 = P2 + ρgy2 + 0.5ρv2^2)
post.description: Validates if Bernoulli's equation holds true for the given fluid properties and conditions at two points. Returns boolean. Note- Uses strict equality (===) which may be sensitive to floating-point precision; consider tolerance for real-world checks.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

result.description: True if both sides of the equation are equal (may require floating-point tolerance).

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers).

post.summary: Calculates dynamic viscosity (η = F * Δy / (A * Δvx))
post.description: Calculates dynamic viscosity based on force, velocity gradient, and area. This equation is derived from shear stress/strain rate.

F.description: Force tangential to the fluid layer (F)

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, A or deltaVx is zero).

post.description: Calculates kinematic viscosity from dynamic viscosity and density.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, density is zero).

post.summary: Calculates drag force (F_d = 0.5 * ρ * C_A * v^2)
post.description: Calculates the drag force on an object moving through a fluid.

CA.description: Drag coefficient multiplied by reference area (C_A)

v.description: Velocity of the object relative to the fluid (v)

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers).

post.description: Calculates the Mach number, the ratio of an object's speed to the speed of sound in the medium.

c.description: Speed of sound in the medium (c)

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, speed of sound is zero).

post.summary: Calculates Reynolds number (Re = (ρ * v * D) / η)
post.description: Calculates the Reynolds number, a dimensionless quantity used to predict flow patterns in different fluid flow situations.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, viscosity is zero).

post.description: Calculates the Froude number, a dimensionless quantity used to indicate the influence of gravity on fluid motion.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, negative values for sqrt, g or l is zero).

post.description: Calculates the surface tension of a liquid based on force and length.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, length is zero).

post.description: Calculates the attractive gravitational force between two point masses. Note- returns a negative value indicating attraction.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, radius is zero).

post.description: Calculates the gravitational field strength at a distance from a point mass. Note- returns a negative value indicating direction towards the mass.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, radius is zero).

post.summary: Calculates gravitational potential energy between two masses (PE = -Gm1m2/r)
post.description: Calculates the gravitational potential energy of a system of two point masses.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

200.description: Successful calculation of gravitational potential energy.

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, radius is zero).

post.description: Calculates the gravitational potential at a distance from a point mass.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, radius is zero).

post.description: Calculates the speed of an object in a circular orbit around a larger mass.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, negative values for sqrt, radius is zero).

post.description: Calculates the minimum speed needed to escape the gravitational pull of a mass from a given distance.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, negative values for sqrt, radius is zero).

post.description: Calculates the rate of heat transfer by conduction through a material. Note- The function calculates Q, assuming a time interval is implied by the equation's usual use for rate. Documentation states Q, but the equation is typically for Q/t. Clarifying this difference. The function returns the result of the right side of the rate equation.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

200.description: Successful calculation of heat transfer rate.

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, thickness is zero).

post.summary: Calculates thermal radiation power (P = εσA(T^4 - T0^4))
post.description: Calculates the net rate of energy radiated by an object, considering its surroundings.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, negative temperatures for power calculation).

post.summary: Calculates peak wavelength using Wien's Law (λ_max = b/T)
post.description: Calculates the wavelength at which the emission spectrum of a black body is maximum.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, temperature is zero).

post.summary: Calculates peak frequency using Wien's Law (f_max = b' * T)
post.description: Calculates the frequency at which the emission spectrum of a black body is maximum. Note- This version uses a modified Wien's constant b'.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers).

get.summary: Get summary information about all the equations in the API.
get.description: Retrieves summary information on all endpoints in the API.

parameters.name: language_code
parameters.description: The language code for the equation summary. Select from the supported list.

200.description: Successful response with array of equation summaries.

subject.description: The subject the equation belongs to.

language_code.description: The language code of the returned details (Note - Code uses 'lang' query param or defaults 'en').

400.description: Bad Request - Equation ID is missing or invalid.

get.summary: Get detailed equation information by subject, id, and language code.
get.description: Retrieves details for a specific equation based on its unique ID and the desired language. Note - The language is extracted from the 'language_code' path parameter. The internal logic shown in the code snippet also looks at a 'lang' query parameter, but this Swagger definition documents the primary path parameters.

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the subject of the equation (e.g., 'Physics').

parameters.name: equation_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the equation (e.g., 'centripetal-acceleration') which is the endpoint of the post request to generate a calculation.

parameters.name: language_code
parameters.description: The language code for the equation details. Select from the supported list.

subject.description: The subject the equation belongs to.

language_code.description: The language code of the returned details (Note - Code uses 'lang' query param or defaults 'en').

400.description: Bad Request - Equation ID is missing or invalid.

get.summary: Get summary information about all the equations in the API that contain a specific term.
get.description: Retrieves summary information on endpoints in the API that contain a specific term.

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the subject of the equation (e.g., 'Physics').

parameters.name: search_term
parameters.description: The term to search for in the equation names or descriptions.

parameters.name: language_code
parameters.description: The language code for the equation summary. Select from the supported list.

200.description: Successful response with array of equation summaries.

subject.description: The subject the equation belongs to.

language_code.description: The language code of the returned details (Note - Code uses 'lang' query param or defaults 'en').

400.description: Bad Request - Equation ID is missing or invalid.

post.description: Calculates velocity based on displacement and time (v = Δs / Δt).

post.summary: Validates impulse-momentum theorem (F * Δt = m * Δv)
post.description: Checks if impulse equals change in momentum for given values. Returns boolean.

result.description: True if impulse equals change in momentum within floating point tolerance.

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers).

post.summary: Calculates average activity in radioactive decay (A_avg = ΔN/Δt)
post.description: Calculates the average activity (rate of decay) of a radioactive sample over a time interval. Note- Function uses `nValue` for number of nuclei ΔN and `tValue` for time Δt. This is a simplified average over Δt, instantaneous activity is dN/dt = -λN.

nValue.description: Change in number of radioactive nuclei (ΔN)

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, time is zero).

post.summary: Calculates remaining quantity after decay (N = N0 * (1/2)^(t/T_half))
post.description: Calculates the remaining quantity of a substance after a time based on its half-life. Note- Uses `tValue` for time and `Thalf` for half-life.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, half-life is zero or negative).

post.description: Calculates the absorbed dose of radiation based on the energy absorbed by a mass. Note- Uses `EValue` for energy and `mValue` for mass.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, mass is zero).

post.summary: Calculates equivalent radiation dose (H = wR * D)
post.description: Calculates the equivalent dose, accounting for the biological effectiveness of different types of radiation. Note- Uses `DValue` for absorbed dose.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers).

post.summary: Calculates effective radiation dose (E = wT * H)
post.description: Calculates the effective dose, accounting for the sensitivity of different tissues/organs to radiation. Note- Uses `HValue` for equivalent dose.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers).

post.description: Calculates the angle of the Cherenkov cone formed by a charged particle moving faster than the speed of light in a medium. Returns angle in radians.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, particle speed in medium less than or equal to c/n, n or vp is zero).

post.description: Calculates the position of the nth bright fringe in a Young's double-slit interference pattern.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, slit separation is zero).

post.description: Calculates the refractive index of a medium based on the speed of light in vacuum and in the medium.

v.description: Speed of light in the medium (v)

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

200.description: Successful calculation of index of refraction.

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, speed in medium is zero).

post.description: Checks if Snell's Law holds for light passing between two media with given refractive indices and angles. Returns boolean. Angles should be in radians. Note- Uses strict equality (===) which may be sensitive to floating-point precision; consider tolerance for real-world checks.

theta1.description: Angle of incidence in medium 1 in radians (θ1)

theta2.description: Angle of refraction in medium 2 in radians (θ2)

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers).

post.description: Calculates the critical angle for total internal reflection when light goes from a medium with index n1 to n2 (n1 > n2). Returns angle in radians.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, n1 <= n2 resulting in invalid arcsin argument, n1 is zero).

post.description: Checks if the relationship between focal length, object distance, and image distance holds true. Returns boolean. Note- Uses strict equality (===) which may be sensitive to floating-point precision; consider tolerance for real-world checks.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

result.description: True if the lens/mirror equation holds.

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, any of the inputs is zero).

post.summary: Validates magnification equation (h'/h = -di/do) (Function uses h'/h = di/do)
post.description: Checks if the relationship between object/image heights and distances holds true. Returns boolean. Note- Uses strict equality (===) which may be sensitive to floating-point precision. The function uses the magnitude relationship `h'/h = di/do` rather than the signed magnification equation. Documenting based on function implementation. Consider tolerance for real-world checks.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, ho or do is zero).

post.summary: Calculates focal length of a spherical mirror (f = r/2)
post.description: Calculates the focal length of a spherical mirror based on its radius of curvature.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers).

post.summary: Calculates potential energy in a spring (PE = 0.5 * k * Δx^2)
post.description: Calculates the elastic potential energy stored in an ideal spring.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (default is 4, value must be 0-16)

200.description: Successful calculation of spring potential energy.

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, negative k).

post.summary: Calculates period of a spring-mass SHO (T = 2π√(m/k))
post.description: Calculates the period of oscillation for a simple harmonic oscillator consisting of a mass on a spring.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, negative values for sqrt, k is zero).

post.summary: Calculates period of a simple pendulum (T = 2π√(l/g))
post.description: Calculates the period of oscillation for a simple pendulum at small angles.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, negative values for sqrt, g is zero).

post.description: Calculates frequency from the period of oscillation.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, Period is zero).

post.description: Calculates angular frequency from frequency.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers).

post.description: Calculates the Lorentz factor using γ = 1/√(1 - (v²/c²)). Requires v < c.

v.description: Velocity (v). Must be a finite number.

c.description: Speed of light in vacuum (c). Must be a positive finite number.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4). Value must be 0-16.

200.description: Successful calculation of Lorentz factor. Returns Infinity if v=c.

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, c is not positive, |v| > c).

error.description: Error message describing the validation failure (e.g., "Velocity (v) cannot be greater than the speed of light (c).").

post.description: Calculates the time elapsed (t') for an observer in an inertial frame S, given the proper time (t₀) measured in a moving frame S' and the relative velocity (v) between S and S'. Uses t' = t₀ / √(1 - (v²/c²)). Requires t₀ ≥ 0 and |v| ≤ c. Units of t' will be the same as t₀, units of v and c must be consistent.

t0.description: Proper time (t₀) measured in the moving frame. Must be a non-negative finite number.

v.description: Relative velocity (v) between the observer's frame and the moving frame. Must be a finite number.

c.description: Speed of light in vacuum (c). Must be a positive finite number.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4). Value must be 0-16.

200.description: Successful calculation of dilated time. Returns Infinity if v=c (and t0 > 0), or 0 if t0=0.

result.description: Dilated time (t') measured in the observer's frame. Same units as t₀.

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, t0 is negative, c is not positive, |v| > c).

error.description: Error message describing the validation failure.

post.description: Calculates the length (L') of an object observed from a moving frame S', given its proper length (L₀) measured in its rest frame S and the relative velocity (v) between S and S'. Uses L' = L₀ * √(1 - (v²/c²)). Requires L₀ ≥ 0 and |v| ≤ c. Units of L' will be the same as L₀, units of v and c must be consistent.

L0.description: Proper length (L₀) measured in the rest frame. Must be a non-negative finite number.

v.description: Relative velocity (v) between the observer's frame and the object's rest frame. Must be a finite number.

c.description: Speed of light in vacuum (c). Must be a positive finite number.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4). Value must be 0-16.

200.description: Successful calculation of contracted length. Returns 0 if |v|=c (and L0 > 0), or 0 if L0=0.

result.description: Contracted length (L') measured in the observer's frame. Same units as L₀.

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, L0 is negative, c is not positive, |v| > c).

error.description: Error message describing the validation failure.

post.description: Calculates the velocity (u') of an object relative to a frame S', given its velocity (u) relative to a frame S, and the velocity (v) of frame S relative to frame S'. Uses the equation u' = (u + v) / (1 + uv/c²). Assumes motion along the same line. Requires c ≠ 0. Units of u, v, and c must be consistent.

u.description: Velocity of the object relative to frame S (u). Must be a finite number.

v.description: Velocity of frame S relative to frame S' (v). Must be a finite number.

c.description: Speed of light (c). Must be a non-zero finite number.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4). Value must be 0-16.

200.description: Successful calculation of the relativistic relative velocity.

result.description: Velocity of the object relative to frame S' (u'). Same units as u and v.

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, c is zero, input velocities cause denominator to be zero).

error.description: Error message describing the validation failure.

post.description: Calculates the total relativistic energy of a particle with rest mass (m) moving at velocity (v). Uses the equation E = γmc² = mc² / √(1 - (v²/c²)). Primarily for particles with rest mass (m > 0). Requires m ≥ 0 and |v| ≤ c. Units of m, v, and c must be consistent to yield energy in appropriate units (e.g., m in kg, v/c in m/s gives E in Joules).

m.description: Rest mass (m) of the particle. Must be a non-negative finite number.

v.description: Velocity (v) of the particle. Must be a finite number.

c.description: Speed of light in vacuum (c). Must be a positive finite number.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4). Value must be 0-16.

200.description: Successful calculation of relativistic total energy. Returns Infinity if m > 0 and |v|=c, or 0 if m=0 and v=0 (though m=0, v=c is required for massless particles).

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, m is negative, c is not positive, |v| > c, or attempting to calculate for massless particle with |v| ≠ c).

error.description: Error message describing the validation failure.

post.description: Calculates the relativistic momentum of a particle with rest mass (m) moving at velocity (v). Uses the equation p = γmv = mv / √(1 - (v²/c²)). Primarily for particles with rest mass (m > 0). Requires m ≥ 0 and |v| ≤ c. Units of m, v, and c must be consistent to yield momentum in appropriate units (e.g., m in kg, v in m/s, c in m/s gives p in kg·m/s).

m.description: Rest mass (m) of the particle. Must be a non-negative finite number.

v.description: Velocity (v) of the particle. Must be a finite number.

c.description: Speed of light in vacuum (c). Must be a positive finite number.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4). Value must be 0-16.

200.description: Successful calculation of relativistic momentum. Returns ±Infinity if m > 0 and |v|=c (sign matches v), or 0 if m=0.

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, m is negative, c is not positive, |v| > c, or attempting to calculate for massless particle with |v| ≠ c).

error.description: Error message describing the validation failure.

post.summary: Calculates total energy from momentum and rest mass (E)
post.description: Calculates the total relativistic energy of a particle from its relativistic momentum (p) and rest mass (m). Uses the energy-momentum relation: E² = (pc)² + (mc²)². This equation is valid for both massive (m > 0) and massless (m = 0) particles. Requires p ≥ 0, m ≥ 0, and c > 0. Units of p, m, and c must be consistent.

p.description: Relativistic momentum (p). Usually the magnitude, must be a non-negative finite number.

m.description: Rest mass (m). Must be a non-negative finite number.

c.description: Speed of light in vacuum (c). Must be a positive finite number.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4). Value must be 0-16.

result.description: Total energy (E). Units depend on input units.

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, p or m is negative, c is not positive).

error.description: Error message describing the validation failure.

post.description: Calculates the rest energy (E₀) equivalent of a given rest mass (m) using Einstein's famous equation E₀ = mc². Requires m ≥ 0 and c > 0. Units of m and c must be consistent (e.g., m in kg, c in m/s gives E₀ in Joules). This endpoint uses a standard value for c (approx 299792458 m/s) unless 'c' is explicitly provided.

m.description: Rest mass (m). Must be a non-negative finite number.

c.description: Optional speed of light in vacuum (c). If not provided, a standard value is used. Must be a positive finite number if provided.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4). Value must be 0-16.

result.description: Rest energy (E₀). Units depend on input units or the standard c value used.

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, m is negative, provided c is not positive).

error.description: Error message describing the validation failure.

post.description: Calculates the relativistic kinetic energy of a particle with rest mass (m) moving at velocity (v). Uses the equation KE = (γ - 1)mc² = (1/√(1 - (v²/c²)) - 1)mc². Primarily for particles with rest mass (m > 0). Requires m ≥ 0 and |v| < c. Units of m, v, and c must be consistent to yield energy in appropriate units.

m.description: Rest mass (m) of the particle. Must be a non-negative finite number.

v.description: Velocity (v) of the particle. Must be a finite number.

c.description: Speed of light in vacuum (c). Must be a positive finite number.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4). Value must be 0-16.

200.description: Successful calculation of relativistic kinetic energy. Returns 0 if v=0 or m=0.

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, m is negative, c is not positive, |v| ≥ c, or attempting to calculate for massless particle).

error.description: Error message describing the validation failure.

post.summary: Calculates relativistic longitudinal Doppler effect for wavelength
post.description: Calculates the observed wavelength (λ') of light emitted with proper wavelength (λ₀) from a source moving with relative velocity (v_rel) directly away from or towards the observer. Uses the equation λ' = λ₀√((1 + β)/(1 - β)), where β = v_rel/c. v_rel > 0 for recession (redshift), v_rel < 0 for approach (blueshift). Requires λ₀ > 0 and |v_rel| < c. Units of λ' will be the same as λ₀, units of v_rel and c must be consistent.

lambda0.description: Emitted (proper) wavelength (λ₀) in the source's rest frame. Must be a positive finite number.

v_rel.description: Relative velocity (v_rel) between observer and source. Positive for recession, negative for approach. Must be a finite number.

c.description: Speed of light in vacuum (c). Must be a positive finite number.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4). Value must be 0-16.

200.description: Successful calculation of observed wavelength. Returns Infinity if v_rel=c, 0 if v_rel=-c (assuming lambda0 > 0).

result.description: Observed wavelength (λ'). Same units as λ₀.

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, lambda0 is not positive, c is not positive, |v_rel| ≥ c).

error.description: Error message describing the validation failure.

post.summary: Calculates photon energy from frequency (E = hf)
post.description: Calculates the energy (E) of a photon based on its frequency (f). Uses Planck's relation E = hf. Requires f ≥ 0 and h > 0. Units of h and f must be consistent to yield energy in appropriate units (e.g., h in J·s, f in Hz (s⁻¹) gives E in Joules). This endpoint uses a standard value for h (approx 6.626e-34 J·s) unless 'h' is explicitly provided.

f.description: Frequency (f). Must be a non-negative finite number.

h.description: Optional Planck's constant (h). If not provided, a standard value is used. Must be a positive finite number if provided.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4). Value must be 0-16.

result.description: Photon energy (E). Units depend on input units or the standard h value used.

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, f is negative, provided h is not positive).

error.description: Error message describing the validation failure.

post.summary: Calculates photon momentum from wavelength (p = h/λ)
post.description: Calculates the momentum (p) of a photon based on its wavelength (λ). Uses the relation p = h/λ. Requires λ > 0 and h > 0. Units of h and λ must be consistent to yield momentum in appropriate units (e.g., h in J·s, λ in meters gives p in kg·m/s). This endpoint uses a standard value for h (approx 6.626e-34 J·s) unless 'h' is explicitly provided.

lambda.description: Wavelength (λ). Must be a positive finite number.

h.description: Optional Planck's constant (h). If not provided, a standard value is used. Must be a positive finite number if provided.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4). Value must be 0-16.

result.description: Photon momentum (p). Units depend on input units or the standard h value used.

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, lambda is not positive, provided h is not positive).

error.description: Error message describing the validation failure.

post.summary: Calculates maximum kinetic energy in photoelectric effect (KE_max)
post.description: Calculates the maximum kinetic energy (KE_max) of emitted electrons in the photoelectric effect. Uses the equation KE_max = E_photon - φ, where E_photon is the incoming photon energy and φ is the work function of the material. If E_photon ≤ φ, no electrons are emitted, and KE_max is 0. Requires E_photon ≥ 0 and φ ≥ 0. Units of E_photon and φ must be consistent to yield KE_max in the same units.

photonEnergy.description: Energy of the incoming photon (E_photon). Must be a non-negative finite number.

phi.description: Work function (φ) of the material. Must be a non-negative finite number.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4). Value must be 0-16.

200.description: Successful calculation of maximum kinetic energy. Returns 0 if photon energy is less than or equal to the work function.

result.description: Maximum kinetic energy (KE_max) of the emitted electron.

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, photonEnergy or phi are negative).

error.description: Error message describing the validation failure.

post.summary: Calculates energy or wavenumber for hydrogen-like atom transitions
post.description: Calculates the energy difference (ΔE) or wavenumber (1/λ) for an electron transition between two energy levels in a hydrogen-like atom (Z). Uses the equation Result = Constant * Z² * (1/n_initial² - 1/n_final²). If 'Constant' is the Rydberg energy unit (e.g., in eV), the result is the energy difference E_final - E_initial (positive for absorption, negative for emission). If 'Constant' is the Rydberg constant for wavenumber (e.g., in m⁻¹), the result is the wavenumber 1/λ (positive for emission, negative for absorption). Requires nInitial > 0, nFinal > 0, nInitial ≠ nFinal, Z > 0 (integers), and Constant > 0.

nInitial.description: Principal quantum number of the initial energy level (n_i). Must be a positive integer.

nFinal.description: Principal quantum number of the final energy level (n_f). Must be a positive integer and different from nInitial.

constant.description: The Rydberg constant value in desired units (e.g., Rydberg energy in eV, or Rydberg constant in m⁻¹). Must be a positive finite number.

atomicNumber.description: The atomic number (Z) of the hydrogen-like atom (1 for Hydrogen). Optional, default is 1. Must be a positive integer.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4). Value must be 0-16.

200.description: Successful calculation of the energy difference or wavenumber.

result.description: The calculated value (Energy difference or Wavenumber) in the units defined by the 'constant' parameter.

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, non-positive/non-integer quantum numbers or atomic number, nInitial equals nFinal, constant is not positive).

error.description: Error message describing the validation failure.

post.description: Calculates angular velocity based on change in angle and time.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, deltaT is zero).

post.description: Calculates angular acceleration based on change in angular velocity and time.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, deltaT is zero).

post.summary: Calculates final angular velocity (ω = ω0 + αt)
post.description: Calculates final angular velocity using rotational kinematic equation.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

200.description: Successful calculation of final angular velocity.

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers).

post.description: Calculates final angular position using rotational kinematic equation.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

200.description: Successful calculation of final angular position.

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers).

post.summary: Calculates angular velocity squared (ω^2 = ω0^2 + 2α(θ - θ0))
post.description: Calculates final angular velocity squared using rotational kinematic equation. Note- returns ω^2, not ω.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

200.description: Successful calculation of angular velocity squared.

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers).

post.description: Calculates average angular velocity assuming constant angular acceleration.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

200.description: Successful calculation of average angular velocity.

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers).

post.description: Calculates torque based on radius, force, and the angle between them.

theta.description: Angle between force and radius in radians (θ)

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

post.summary: Calculates torque using rotational 2nd Law (τ = Iα)
post.description: Calculates torque based on moment of inertia and angular acceleration.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers).

post.summary: Calculates moment of inertia for a point mass (I = mr^2)
post.description: Calculates the moment of inertia for a single point mass relative to an axis.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

200.description: Successful calculation of moment of inertia.

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers).

post.description: Calculates the work done by a constant torque over an angular displacement.

deltaTheta.description: Change in angular position in radians (Δθ)

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers).

post.description: Calculates instantaneous rotational power based on torque, angular velocity, and the angle between them.

theta.description: Angle between torque and angular velocity in radians (θ)

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers).

post.description: Calculates the kinetic energy of a rotating object.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

200.description: Successful calculation of rotational kinetic energy.

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers).

post.description: Calculates angular momentum for a point mass moving relative to a point.

theta.description: Angle between radius vector and velocity vector in radians (θ)

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

post.description: Calculates angular impulse from torque and time interval.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

post.description: Calculates Young's Modulus (elastic modulus) of a material under tensile or compressive stress.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

post.description: Calculates the shear modulus (modulus of rigidity) of a material under shear stress.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

post.description: Calculates the bulk modulus of a material under uniform pressure (hydrostatic stress).

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

post.summary: Calculates force of a spring (F = -k * Δx)
post.description: Calculates the restoring force exerted by an ideal spring according to Hooke's Law. Note - returns a negative value indicating the force opposes displacement.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

post.summary: Calculates solid linear thermal expansion (ΔL = αL0ΔT)
post.description: Calculates the change in length of a solid material due to a temperature change.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

200.description: Successful calculation of change in length.

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers).

post.description: Calculates the change in area of a solid material due to a temperature change, using the linear expansion coefficient.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

200.description: Successful calculation of change in area.

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers).

post.description: Calculates the change in volume of a solid material due to a temperature change, using the linear expansion coefficient.

post.summary: Calculates internal energy change for ideal monatomic gas (ΔU = (3/2)nRΔT)
post.description: Calculates the change in internal energy for a monatomic ideal gas undergoing a temperature change.

nR.description: Product of number of moles and Ideal Gas Constant (nR)

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

200.description: Successful calculation of internal energy change.

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers).

post.summary: Calculates thermodynamic work done by system at constant pressure (W = -PΔV)
post.description: Calculates the work done by or on a system during a thermodynamic process at constant pressure. Note- Equation calculates work *done by* the system, positive for expansion, negative for compression. Function returns -P*deltaV, consistent with work *done by* the system according to the equation W = PΔV, with an added negative sign which may imply work *done on* the system depending on convention. Documenting the function's output.

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

result.description: Thermodynamic work done by the system (W) using -PΔV

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers).

post.summary: Calculates efficiency of a real engine (η_real = 1 - (Q_C / Q_H))
post.description: Calculates the thermal efficiency of a heat engine based on heat absorbed and rejected.

QC.description: Heat rejected to the cold reservoir (Q_C)

QH.description: Heat absorbed from the hot reservoir (Q_H)

digits.description: Number of decimal places to round the result to (optional, default is 4, value must be 0-16)

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, QH is zero).

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, TH is zero, temperatures are negative).

post.summary: Calculates Doppler effect velocity factor ((c + v_o) / (c - v_s))
post.description: Calculates the velocity factor portion of the Doppler effect equation (f' = f * factor). Positive velocities for observer moving towards source, source moving towards observer.

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., non-finite numbers, speed of sound is zero, source speed equals speed of sound).
